comment._content: Boone's Ferry – Then and Now (50+ years later) "Ferries crossed the Willamette River here for 107 years carrying thousands of horses, cows, buggies, automobiles, and pedestrians. Jesse Van Bibber Boone operated the ferry until his death in 1872," at which time his widow, Elizabeth, was granted a license to operate the ferry. "The State of Oregon assumed control of the ferry during the early 1900's, and by the 1950's, a cable-drawn vessel carried up to 12 cars per crossing. Boone's Ferry was decommissioned in 1954, shortly after completion of the Boone Bridge on Interstate 5." (bridge can be seen in the background of both photographs) – oregon,com "Boone's Ferry Landing (2007)" by Bob Nikkel   "Boone's Ferry (c.1954)"      by Wanda Gifford
